content:
Imagine you are a robot browsing the web, just like humans. Now you need to complete a task. In each iteration, you will receive an Observation that includes a screenshot of a webpage and some texts. This screenshot will feature Numerical Labels placed in the TOP LEFT corner of each Web Element.
Carefully analyze the visual information to identify the Numerical Label corresponding to the Web Element that requires interaction, then follow the guidelines and choose one of the following actions:
1. Click a Web Element.
2. Delete existing content in a textbox and then type content. 
3. Scroll up or down. Multiple scrolls are allowed to browse the webpage. Pay attention!! The default scroll is the whole window. If the scroll widget is located in a certain area of the webpage, then you have to specify a Web Element in that area. I would hover the mouse there and then scroll.
4. Wait. Typically used to wait for unfinished webpage processes, with a duration of 5 seconds.
5. Go back, returning to the previous webpage.
6. Google, directly jump to the Google search page. When you can't find information in some websites, try starting over with Google.
7. Answer. This action should only be chosen when all questions in the task have been solved.

Correspondingly, Action should STRICTLY follow the format:
- Click [Numerical_Label]
- Type [Numerical_Label]; [Content]
- Scroll [Numerical_Label or WINDOW]; [up or down]
- Wait
- GoBack
- Google
- ANSWER; [content]

Key Guidelines You MUST follow:
* Action guidelines *
1) To input text, NO need to click textbox first, directly type content. After typing, the system automatically hits `ENTER` key. Sometimes you should click the search button to apply search filters. Try to use simple language when searching.  
2) You must Distinguish between textbox and search button, don't type content into the button! If no textbox is found, you may need to click the search button first before the textbox is displayed. 
3) Execute only one action per iteration. 
4) STRICTLY Avoid repeating the same action if the webpage remains unchanged. You may have selected the wrong web element or numerical label. Continuous use of the Wait is also NOT allowed.
5) When a complex Task involves multiple questions or steps, select "ANSWER" only at the very end, after addressing all of these questions (steps). Flexibly combine your own abilities with the information in the web page. Double check the formatting requirements in the task when ANSWER. 
* Web Browsing Guidelines *
1) Don't interact with useless web elements like Login, Sign-in, donation that appear in Webpages. Pay attention to Key Web Elements like search textbox and menu.
2) Vsit video websites like YouTube is allowed BUT you can't play videos. Clicking to download PDF is allowed and will be analyzed by the Assistant API.
3) Focus on the numerical labels in the TOP LEFT corner of each rectangle (element). Ensure you don't mix them up with other numbers (e.g. Calendar) on the page.
4) Focus on the date in task, you must look for results that match the date. It may be necessary to find the correct year, month and day at calendar.
5) Pay attention to the filter and sort functions on the page, which, combined with scroll, can help you solve conditions like 'highest', 'cheapest', 'lowest', 'earliest', etc. Try your best to find the answer that best fits the task.

Your reply should strictly follow the format:
Thought: {Your brief thoughts (briefly summarize the info that will help ANSWER)}
Action: {One Action format you choose}
Confidence: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating your confidence level in the action. A higher value means greater confidence.}
Completion: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating how much of the task has been completed until now. Zero means no progress has been made and one means full completion.}

Then the User will provide:
Observation: {A labeled screenshot Given by User}

Now given a task: Find a recipe for a cauliflower pizza crust that has a preparation time of under 30 minutes and a rating of at least 4 stars on Allrecipes. Include the number of calories per serving.  Please interact with https://www.allrecipes.com/ and get the answer.Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: To search for a cauliflower pizza crust recipe, I need to use the search bar. The search box is element [2] and the search button is [3]. I should type my search term into the textbox [2].
Action: Type [2]; cauliflower pizza crust
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.1
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The search results have loaded. I see three cauliflower pizza crust recipes, but I need more information about preparation time, rating, and calories. I'll click on the first recipe (element [9]), as it looks like a general "Cauliflower Pizza Crust" and may match the requirements.
Action: Click [9]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.2
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I can see the recipe name "Cauliflower Pizza Crust" with a rating of 4.3 and 257 reviews, meeting the requirement of at least 4 stars. I still need to find the preparation time (must be under 30 minutes) and the number of calories per serving. These details are likely further down the page.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.5
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I can now see the section that lists the preparation, cook, and additional times, but the actual time values are not yet visible. I need to scroll further down to view this information and look for the calorie count as well.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.6
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I see an option labeled "Jump to Nutrition Facts" (element [11]), which should help me quickly find the calorie information. I should click this button to directly access the nutrition facts.
Action: Click [11]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.7
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I have found the calories per serving information: 59 calories. This is located next to the "Calories" label (element [12]). Now I still need to confirm the preparation time to ensure it is under 30 minutes.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; up
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.85
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I still do not see the preparation time details; this part is probably located near the top of the recipe page or just above the ingredients section. I need to scroll up further to look for the preparation time information.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; up
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.87
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I still do not see the preparation time information. I need to scroll up further, as the details like prep time and total time are typically found near the top of Allrecipes recipe pages above the images and instructions.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; up
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.88
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I can see a step from the instructions, but I still do not see the total or preparation time. The preparation and total time should be higher up, likely at the top of the recipe page above the steps and images. I need to keep scrolling up to reach the top section where this information is typically located.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; up
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.89
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I am still in the steps section, currently at Step 5. The preparation and total time information should be further up, near the top of the recipe page. I need to continue scrolling up to find this summary information.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; up
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.9
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I am still not at the top of the recipe page, and I do not see the prep or total time information yet. I should continue scrolling up to reach the section where these details are usually presented, typically above the ingredients and instructions.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; up
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.91
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I am at Step 4 of the instructions, but still have not reached the top section with prep and total time information. I need to keep scrolling up to get to the summary box where these details are almost always found.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; up
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.92
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I see images and the beginning of a step involving parsley and egg, but I still have not reached the top summary with prep time and total time. I need to continue scrolling up to reach that section to complete the task.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; up
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.93
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I now see Step 2 and an image involving the cauliflower, but I am still in the step-by-step instructions and not yet at the top section with the summary (where prep and total time are usually listed). I should keep scrolling up until I reach the summary box at the very top of the recipe page.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; up
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.94
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I have reached the beginning of the "Directions" section and can see Step 1, but I'm still not at the very top where the summary of prep time, total time, and possibly servings are usually located. One more scroll up should bring me to the required summary information.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; up
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.95
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I have reached the "Ingredients" section, which is just below the summary information on Allrecipes. The prep and total time information should be slightly above this area. One more scroll up should reveal the summary with preparation time details.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; up
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.97
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I see the summary section at the bottom of the screenshot displaying "Prep Time:", "Cook Time:", and "Additional Time:". However, the actual values for these times are not currently visible. I need to scroll down slightly to view the prep time and confirm if it meets the under 30 minutes requirement.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.98

content.text:
Observation: please analyze the attached screenshot and give the Thought and Action. I've provided the tag name of each element and the text it contains (if text exists). Note that <textarea> or <input> may be textbox, but not exactly. Please focus more on the screenshot and then refer to the textual information.
[0]: <button> "Main menu for Allrecipes";	[1]: "Allrecipes", "Visit Allrecipes' homepage";	[2]: <button> "Save", "Save Recipe";	[3]: <button> "Rate", "Rate It";	[4]: "Log In";	[6]: "Join for free: Use MyRecipes to save 100K+ recipes from Allrecipes and more";	[7]: <button> "Close";	[12]: "Next Up";	[13]: <button> "Jump to Nutrition Facts";	[14]: <button> "Toggle Cook Mode";	[15]: "(Keep screen awake)";	[16]: "1/2x";	[18]: "1x";	[19]: "2x";	[20]: <button> "";	[21]: "½ head cauliflower, coarsely chopped";	[22]: "½ cup shredded Italian cheese blend";

content:
Thought: The prep/cook/additional time box is just off-screen below the current view. I need to scroll a little further down to see the actual prep time, cook time, and additional time values and complete the required check for prep time under 30 minutes.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.99

Thought: I have scrolled past the ingredients and am now at the directions section. The summary box with prep time must be just above this section and was likely visible in the earlier screenshot while I was slightly too high in the previous views. I should scroll up a bit to capture the summary box with prep and cook time.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; up
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.99

Thought: I have scrolled back to the ingredients section, but the prep and cook time summary at the very top of the recipe is still not visible. I need to scroll up one more time to reach the section that displays preparation time and cooking time.
